EmoteActions.Message: Ugh! I hate this stuff, but I have a friend who likes it. Maybe you should drop in on him.
What do you want me to do with this? Pick my teeth? Stop bothering me I have some serious drinking to do.
You find enough of this you might be able to have some tailor make a really fine shirt.
Hey. This is stolen property. I might swill my share of ale, but I'm not swilling my brew from Celcynd's mug.

No, no, that's your robe now. I have quite a few of them myself. Thanks again for finding those wand splinters. I can't stand the thought of a bunch of semi-literate drunken fools ruining my good name.
Bwahahaha!!! People are still trying to bring me these things?
SplintersGivenUlgrim@Done
Thanks, but I don't need anymore splinters.
Aw! None Left!
Nothing like an Ulgrim's Brew in the crisp mountain air.
Cold-brewed to warm the bones.
Ayan Baqur used to be such a wonderful place to live. People were always so... respectful of...
Who am I kidding? That place has been a hive of scum and villainy for years. But the state of affairs in my hometown has little to do with my latest excursion!

Let's look at this situation from a practical standpoint. Yes, it is cold here. Yes, there was no brew here before I came along. But there's no incessant wars between people just beside the lifestone. There's no chance that those blasted Burun coming here. They hate cold!
So, this really isn't a bad place to be right now.
Get beer.
Get beer from keg.
Get beer from keg now.
Get out! Geesh, some people just don't understand an adventure.
I drank that sake crud the other day. You know what it did to me?

Hallucinations! I saw myself in the belly of the beast literally. It was horrible. A stomach surrounded me on all sides, my legs burned and itched as acid ate away at my clothing and flesh. Then the most horrible thing of all happened. I dropped my beer!
This little mosswart fellow came into town screaming about the Burun.
I gave him a drink to calm him down. He gave me a stone that smells like something plucked from a mattekar's hind quarters. I figure I'll throw it at the next Burun I see.
Guess what I'm doing tomorrow night.
The same thing I do every night.
You know you're a real hero if you can fight naked.
I wish I could fly. You think with all this magic in the world we would have magical flight.
I want to fly!
I need a cape too.
I met this small man yesterday. He had a mask on and these big red gloves. He talked about scrolls and buttons. We shared a few cold ones and then he had to get back to his chainmail or something.
Strong little fellow...
Are you naive enough to think Elysa runs Dereth? Hmm.

There is a conspiracy that those in power don't want you to know. I can't tell you everything, not yet. I can tell you there is a cabal of mages in the upper echelons of our government who control every aspect of our society. Do you think that the Olthoi Invasion happened by chance?
Just ask yourself, who is the fourth man?
You know, Muldaveus and Niarltah asked me to join their Renegade cause. I was going to join too...

Then they told me that they didn't supply the Breakfast Beer, Morning Mickeys, Spring-to-Action Ale, Midday Mead, Late-Night Lager or Sleepy-Time Stout. So I told them that they could take their Mattekar Swill and stuff it. My allegiance to Elysa could never be bought!
Fill me up a Beer Stein and I'll tell you the story of how I tied to a broken lifestone.
You the man!
You say, "No, You the man!"
You're right, I am.
There aren't a lot of stimulating people to talk to around here.
I don't mean you of course, you're fascinating.
I had a bad dream the other night. I was in the ruins of some town and I couldn't get anyone to talk to me or give me stout.
That wasn't the worst part of the dream though. There were these horrible wormy things floating around and I was terrified they would see me.
I thought Mosswarts smelled bad, but Burun smell like Tremendous Monouga feet. At least you know when they're close.
I saw a cute little Ursuin Cub the other day. I tried to pat it on the head. Cute little teeth on that cub. See my cute little bite mark?
Have you noticed how dazed the people at fishing holes look?
Just try talking to one of them. You'll be lucky if they even acknowledge you. More than likely they'll just stand there casting and casting and casting.
They're Fishing Zombies! Fishing Zombies I tells you!
Wish I could take my sword with me. I'd at the very least like to have it on my wall at home.

It's really good to be back in Ayan Baqur. It hasn't changed all that much. The big difference is I see more crazy fools running around killing each other than I used to. How can they stand all the Vitae?
I hear old Jaleh got killed. Aaminah really looks as if she's broken up over it. I think we should elect a new leader for Ayan Baqur.
Now let's see... who would make a good leader?
No, I couldn't!
Could I?
I'll do it! I will shoulder the heavy burden of leadership.
First law I pass? Free drinks for the Mayor!
I visited Claude and Leopold yesterday.
Same old virindi. Still think that we can't tell they aren't human.
I asked them to go cliff diving with me tomorrow. Hehe.
I told them it was a traditional human activity.
I'll just make sure they jump first.
People were surprised that I changed my portal recall spell. Hey, I warned people it would change. It's my spell and I go where I like. Plus, I don't really trust Lifestone Recall anymore...
If you want to get to my island then talk to the Drunken Madman, he knows the way.
Now I have the power of ten Uglrims!
From hence forth I will be know as Captain Stout! An amazing hero devoted to truth, justice and the pursuit of free drinks.
Wherever there are those in need of help, I'll be there!
Wherever there is a wrong to be righted, I'll be there!
Wherever a stout is left standing unwatched, I will be there!
You know I'm glad my duplicates are gone, but I've been thinking of the glorious things we could have accomplished.
We could have formed an Fellowship of Ulgrim, roaming the land looking for people to save and drinks to be drunk.
We could have tried out a few of the group spells I've been dabbling with.
We could have gone on fishing trips.
...I miss those guys.
I hear if you lick a Burun you can see all sorts of cool stuff.
So, did you see the Archmage in Candeth Keep? I hear her husband is out of the picture. She can buff me anytime! Hubba! Hubba!
Where's everyone getting those slick looking hats and suits from?
I'd look pretty good in one of those getups don't you think?
Yeah, I'd be like Jack Diamond in the "Dark Mystery of the Stolen Stuff!"
That was a great story.
I went to visit the fortune shrine today. Want to hear my fortune?
You will fall into a very deep hole and your broken body will slowly be devoured by the foul things that reside in the lightless places.
That didn't sound so good.
My lucky numbers are 6,6,6.
Easy guys, I drink my stout just like the rest of you - one sip at a time. Except, once my mug's empty, I make gold gromnies.
Some monsters get stronger, some monsters get weaker. Just remember what ol' Ulgrim says when the health is down, fire is raining from the sky and monsters are clawing at his throat.
Strong...weak. I'm the one with the wand.
Are you standing comfortably?
Then we'll begin...
Patty Cake
Patty Cake
Baker's man
Bake me a cake
As fast as you can.
I was writing spell on this scroll
An ah shallow shark was like Grrrr Grrrr Grrrr
And then, like half my scroll was gone... and I was like...
Unnhh?
It devoured my spell... was a really good spell and then I had to write it again and I had to do it fast, so it wasn't as good...
It's kind of.....
a bummer.
I'm Ulgrim and I'm a mage.
Some mage called me a gimp the other day.
I asked him what a gimp was and he said "You, Gimpy! What kind of a gimp mage has a 40 Focus?"
So I portaled him to that new valley everyone is talking about to find out what kind of mage he is.
I guess he didn't realize that I had used a few attribute transfer gems... What a gimp.
Dance for me Drudge Boy!
Ulgrim pauses.
Ulgrim the Unpleasant tells you, "%s?"
I have heard some weird names, but...
What were your parents thinking?!
I've learned all the portal spells. I especially like the Tie to Ispar.
Shurov Thispar!
Your Mom says Hi.
It's time to kick it!
That's my new dance!
I bet you didn't know that some magical components are quite deadly if ingested.
I sure didn't.
I'm gonna need more cowbell!

I've been working on some Olthoi Bait in case they decide to come back. Through long and arduous testing I've discovered that they can't resist stuffed mushrooms. Just walk through a dungeon dropping those things in a line and you can ambush a whole swarm while they're gobbling them up.
If we build a new town I say we call it Ulgrim's Ridge. Now that's a town name with style!
Someone's been staying at my house. I noticed my porridge was eaten and my bed was all mussed up. If I catch him he'll be sorry.
A bad decision
Drinking alone in the rain
Sorrow wet and cold
Have you seen some of these people's names? So... their mother was really a mule? So they can't reproduce then? That's probably for the best.
Good Stuff!
Whoa!
That's why I don't do that.
I've drunk things you people wouldn't believe.
Burning Mana Blasts off the coast of the Caul.
I've watched pint glasses glitter in the ephemeral light of portal space.
All these memories will be lost, like stout from a keg...
Time to drink.
Did you know my face is on the Soul Staff?
Yup, I'm immortalized! It's the third face down. Some people may claim it's the guy who created the staff, but he's nobody and I'm famous.
Yesterday, I almost drank a one that was not cold. Good thing I caught myself in time!
So! You think you can out-drink me?
Yeah, and maybe tuskers will fly out of my...
But, seriously you haven't got a chance. I've been training my entire life!
I'll stop what those Virindi are planning. Just as soon as I figure out what that plan is.
Hey don't worry, I can handle it. I drank something.
What's with the rabbit costume?
Let me give you a bit of advice my friend. Never look up a magician's robe, it ruins the surprise. Wait, or was it a magician's sleeve?

So you've heard about Leandra's wonderful new chorizite formula? Yeah, made that same formula years ago, except I used orichalcum. My formula made normal beer mugs larger on the inside than on the outside. I only have the one sample left here. It holds about 30 normal mugs of stout.
It's good that she's following in my footsteps though, it shows she's very wise.

Ulgrim stumbles and mutters something unintelligible, "Y syh uhla tnaysat ra fyc y piddanvmo. Frah ra yfuga, ra hu muhkan ghaf ev ra fyc y piddanvmo tnaysehk ra fyc y syh, un y syh fru ryt tnaysat ra fyc y piddanvmo."
Hey, kid.
Catch.
That white rabbit may look cute an fluffy, but he's an abomination.
Bah! I told you so!

I was tired of having to run over hills just to kill a creature so I created the Arcing Spells. Now everyone is using them and nobody is giving me any credit! I think I deserve the title Archmage at least.

Ulgrim the Archmage, Master of Time and Space, Leader of the Virindi Resistance, Master Tinkerer, Seer of Truths, Lord of the Jewelry, Supreme Peppermint Cook, Celebrations Advisor to the Queen, Chess Grandmaster, the Shadow Tested, Virindi Regulator and Beer Lord. Yes, that fits nicely with my other titles.
I heard Claude muttering smugly about how the Virindi are masters of time and space. Great bunch of hogwash, that is. I'm the master of time and space.

I was telling my cousin the other day about this big tusker I saw while traveling across the barren plains. Now, when I say big I mean huge! This thing must have stood over 50 feet tall and it had this strange look in its eyes.
It tried to step on me, but I shockwaved it in the orbs and ran for it. Aliester didn't believe me at first, but I convinced him.
I don't trust that Virindi, Claude, he's hiding something from the rest of us.
Late at night I hear noises and see blue flickering lights coming from his tent.
What's he doing in there?
What the heck is he doing in there?
Those mansions I've seen are pretty nice, but nowhere near as nice as the house I built for myself. I used to have a fortress on Asheron's Island, but the neighbors were too loud.
Did you ever wonder where the eggs we eat come from? And what about the supposed chicken our cooks make? I don't eat either of them... just in case.
You know what the Virindi call a Royal Atlatl with Deadly Darts?
A Royal Atlatl with Deadly Darts. The Virindi aren't all that creative.
You think Marae Lassel is so great huh?  Here's one important question you have to ask yourself: Does it have Ulgrim on it?  That should tell you all you need to know.

You cannot always acquire what you desire.  You cannot always acquire what you desire.  But if you attempt it occasionally, you potentially could discover, that you acquire what you require.  I'm thinking of setting it to music.
The grass is always greener on the other side.  At least at my house it was.  It's not my fault Dad never understood the basics of preventative lawn care!
You doubt my chess abilities? Let me put it this way. Have you ever heard of Yuri, Bobby, Trumper, Blue?
Morons.
Epileptic spongemonkies? I never said that!
What's this?
Hey! This is half of that spell I wrote!
Good thing I was able to find the other half at my house. Now let's see...
A little here...
A little there...
There good as new... almost. Wow, this is a really good spell. Let me just copy this down...
Ulgrim crouches and writes the spell on the back of his hand.
Here...
I want you to have it. It won't be all that useful to you I'm afraid, but you never know. Just don't depend on it. I have places to go to.
Aha! Another ring for my collection.
Of course I already found the only ring I'll ever need, but thanks.
Hey, good stuff, thanks. Tough to find this around here. What? You're standing there looking at me with your mouth open. You expect me to say something special for this? I'm not a performing monkey!
Expect me to drink this eh?
Ulgrim drinks the mead quickly.
Bleh! Too sweet, I prefer something a bit... stouter.
Ale? I don't drink water unless I have to.
But, I might have to so I'll just hold onto this.
Not bad, nice beer stein too. It reminds me of that time I was in Dryreach.

I had decided to go on a trip. I was tired of all the sun and relaxation, you know how it is. Anyway, I traveled around for awhile visiting pubs and inns and ended up in Dryreach, where I was astonished to find a wonderful house brew made by my friend Mordomor.

I decided to spend awhile getting to know the drink better so I went to find the old lifestone NW of town. Yeah, I know there's a new lifestone there, but I didn't know that then. The old lifestone looked broken, but by this time I was heavily in my cups and unconcerned with trivial things.

Now, I'm going to give you a very important bit of information here. Never ever, under ANY circumstances, bind to a lifestone when you're drunk. And if you have an old faulty wand. And if it looks like the lifestone's broken... especially if it looks like the lifestone is broken. I remember wondering why the lifestone was sparking like that, then why my wand was sparking like that. Then my wand caught fire, shot from my hand and exploded... then things got weird.

Everything after that is fuzzy, but I remember dying repeatedly. Not something I recommend, but what with all the explosions and electric shocks it seemed like the thing to do. My life flashed before my eyes, at least the part that involved being repeatedly killed and revived by a demented lifestone.

When I came to I found that the bodies I had left during my reincarnations hadn't died. In fact there were nine copies of myself standing around arguing with each other. I could have sworn that I died more than nine times, but like I said before I was pretty vitae'd up.

I've heard of similar lifestone malfunctions before. Usually the duplicate is just a creepy standing corpse of sorts that hasn't forgotten how to breathe. In most cases unbinding from your lifestone will return that corpse's lifeforce or vitae back to its owner.

But to unbind from the lifestone I needed to use the same casting device that I tied to it with. By the time I found one of my wand's splinters in the pocket of my robe I realized the duplicates of me had run off.

It turned out that each of my copies had a splinter from the wand. I was too weak to get them back myself, so I enlisted the help of adventurers. These good people collected all the splinters of my wand and brought them back to me.

I heard many stories about my duplicates and I actually grew kind of fond of some of them. It was with a heavy heart that I recrafted my wand and unbound from the lifestone. I haven't heard of them since then. I guess they're all gone...
I'll always remember the time we spent together that spring.
Shreth piss. Look kid, get me somethin' else.
Ptooey!
Ulgrim pours out the water.
Ulgrim crosses his arms and mutters something under his breath.
Never touch the stuff.
I just figured it out!
It was so simple. Now we can all go home!
Oh, what's this then? Red? Well...I'll try any drink once.
Do you hear that?
Oh, hello! Were you saying something?
I'm feeling particularly good today for some reason.
Well, glad you could stop by!
Well, it's nice and hot, but it's missing that little kick which makes it really good.
Let's see, just a bit of this stuff...
...and this is a perfect warm me up.
What? You want to know how to make this? No Way! It's a secret, get your own peppermint!
Ulgrim suddenly lurches to the side and spills his drink all over his shirtfront.
Oops.
Hey Peppermint! Have you tried my secret recipe?
Then try some of my Peppermint Pumpkin Pie!
Something doesn't smell quite right about this stuff. You got it from Jaleh's, eh? Well I've no love for the money grabbing b--. Say you don't think that I had anything to...
Well of all the insane ideas to pop into people's heads. Be off with you! I've better things to do than deal with some hack investigation.
Ulgrim swigs the brew.
Whew! Tangy. Yup, that was definitely not right. I feel kind of sleepy. You have any more Ale?
OswaldStep1
CoveOswaldUlgrim
Thank you. This must be an extra piece.
SplintersGivenUlgrim@Test
Word has it that some young upstart has found a way to craft beer from the salivary discharge of the Tusker. I don't know what I think about that. One the one hand... eww. but on the other... beer.

You know, I was the one who fronted the money for Monty the Munificent to build his new casino? He's my sister's idiot son, and I didn't like to see him get rained on in that old outdoor spot of his. I think a man should be able to fleece the unwitting under the comfort of a solid roof.
SplintersGivenUlgrim
I don't need these splinters anymore, but seeing as you went to all that work.
I bestow upon you the Robe of Extraordinary Comfort!
SplintersGivenUlgrim
